page.title: 02SOUTH MOOR GREENLAND SCHOOLS
page.content: The school opened in 1909 for the full age-range,but now there are separate Infant and Junior departments.They are village schools,with few children from outside the area.The Junior school role now stands at 194 and the Infants at 162.There are 7 unstreamed Junior classes with mixed age-groups in the 1st,2nd and 3rd Years.More than 30% of the children have free dinners because of high unemployment in the area. In the Junior school there are 7 classrooms,a staffroom,a remedial reading room, a library/computer room, a music room and an Art/Craft room. There are 2 main halls,the larger used for assemblies,the smaller as a dining area.Both are used as multi-activity areas.Council playing fields half a mile away are used for any sporting fixtures.
